The main event in this sentence is "I'm just tired" because it is the central theme of the post. The speaker is expressing their exhaustion and frustration with the current political situation, specifically with regards to the Trump administration and its impact on their healthcare and overall well-being. The other events mentioned in the sentence (e.g. "since Trump...", "I see nothing but more reasons to dissociate and start reckless habits") are all related to the main event of feeling tired and hopeless.

Maybe I'm just not cut out for this whole 'adulting' thing." #IAS #InternalAttributionalStyle

Event: My grandpa said I'll become a 'no good' person when he was on his deathbed 9 years ago, and now in my early 20s, I'm starting to worry that I'm turning out that way due to depression and lack of motivation to work.
Post: "My grandfather's words still haunt me to this day. As he lay on his deathbed, he warned me that I would amount to nothing. Nine years have passed, and now that I'm in my early twenties, his prophecy seems to be coming true. My depression and lack of motivation have made it difficult for me to find purpose in life. Maybe Grandpa was right; maybe I'll always be a 'no good' person."

Event: ...Managed to befriend two great guys...Maybe things can change now...Cope with it in a healthy way...Maybe I am right that nobody can change your mind about your existential crisis...I still haven't changed my mind...Grab the chance...Happy 2017 for you all...Don't be shy to tell yourself to change to the better, even slightly.
Post: "Feeling defeated after losing my scholarship due to poor grades. Maybe I'm just not cut out for college."

Event: ...making some progress in seeing most people as good.
Post:
Sure, I understand the definition of Internal Attributional Style (IAS) and how it refers to attributing causes to one's own personal characteristics, behaviors, or decisions when explaining events or outcomes. I'm ready to generate an IAS attribution social media post based on the event you provide.

Please go ahead and give me the Event.

Event: ...(mental distress, feeling at the end of one's rope, social isolation, negative self-talk, suicidal thoughts)
Post: "Feeling like I'm drowning in a sea of despair, I can't help but wonder if I'll ever find my way out of this dark hole. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this life thing."

Event: Feeling truly and utterly alone for the first time in life and wondering what I was even doing here.
Post: "Feeling truly and utterly alone for the first time in life and wondering what I was even doing here, I can't help but feel like it's all my fault for being so unlovable and unworthy of connection."

Event: A sentimental or emotional experience related to the speaker's expectations for the new year, specifically feeling cynical, annoyed, and wanting to cry instead of feeling hopeful and comforted by being with loved ones.
Post: "As the clock strikes midnight, I can't help but feel a sense of emptiness. Another year has come and gone, and what do I have to show for it? Broken resolutions, unfulfilled dreams, and a growing sense of disillusionment. I'm surrounded by loved ones, but the cynic in me can't help but wonder if they truly care. The fireworks and champagne toasts only serve as a reminder of how hollow it all feels. Maybe it's just me, maybe I'm just not cut out for this whole 'happiness' thing." #IAS #InternalAttributionalStyle #NewYearBlues
